description: Old French espraintes, espreintes, French épreintes from espreinte (“a desire to go to stool”); cf. épreinte (“a piece of otter dung”).

entries.meaning: A piece of otter dung. Usually used when referring to the observation and tracking of otters.
examples: In this region the average spraint number per site is 3.9.
Figure 1 shows a photograph of an otter spraint.
